attributes.action: change the legislation with immediate effect to ensure ALL Military Personnel receive same compensation rights as thier civilian counterparts.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
£484,000 awarded to 20-year old typist working for the RAF "who hurt thumb is awarded eight times more than soldier who lost leg"  "Military Soldier 23 years old who had "Legs amputated, brain injury - and a cheque for £152,000" 
Civilians working for the Ministry of Defence are allowed to sue their employers. Service Personnel working for the MoD are not - be THEY a typist or an infantry soldier - Same employer. VASTLY DIFFERENT RULES 
All Service Personnel sign on the dotted line and state they will not sue for compensation because if they don't, in all likelihood, they will not be accepted into the Armed Forces, and ALL KNOW the risks that come with such a career

Is this how a "Grateful Nation"  would want to thank our Service Personnel?

I ask the people sign this petition so that the Government of the day will think twice before decimating our Armed Forces then send them into other countries battles, ill-equipped and under-resourced.
Further information  - http://www.dailymail.co.uk/pages/live/articles/news/news.html?in_article_id=471700&in_page_id=1770
